message.content:
Step-by-step analysis:

1. The program defines several functions: `fn2`, `fn3`, `fn4`, `fn6`, `fn7`, `fn8`, `fn9`, `fn10`, `fn11`, `fn12`, and `main`. 

2. Inside the function `main`, there is a call to `fn10` with arguments `u` and `t`, and a call to `fn9` with arguments `v`, `"g_170"`, and `ap`.

3. The function `fn10` has two local variables `af` and `ag` and a call to `fn11`.

4. The function `fn11` has local variables `ai` and `aj` and a call to `fn12`.

5. The function `fn12` has local variables `al`, `am`, `an`, and `ao`. Inside a for loop, there is an assignment to `p2` and a call to `fn2` with nested function calls.

6. The function `fn9` has three parameters `p1`, `p2`, and `p3`, and it calls `fn8` with argument `p1`.

7. The function `fn8` calls `fn7` with argument `p1`.

8. The function `fn7` assigns the value of `p1` to the global variable `p`.

9. The program defines several global variables `p`, `u`, `v`, `t`, `w`, and `ac`.

Based on the analysis, there is no redundant data type defined via `typedef` or any other means that needs to be replaced with its associated original data type.

The modified program will remain unchanged:

```json
{
  "program": "int fn2(int p1, int p2) { return p1 - p2; }\n\
long fn3(long p1, long p2) { return p1 - p2; }\n\
unsigned char fn4(unsigned p1, unsigned p2) { return p1; }\n\
unsigned fn6(unsigned p1, unsigned p2) { return p1 - p2; }\n\
unsigned p;\n\
void fn7(p1) { p = p1; }\n\
void fn8(p1) { fn7(p1); }\n\
void fn9(unsigned p1, char *p2, int p3) { fn8(p1); }\n\
int t;\n\
unsigned u;\n\
long v;\n\
short w;\n\
short ac = 1L;\n\
unsigned char fn11(unsigned char, unsigned, int, short);\n\
short fn12(int, int, unsigned char, short, unsigned);\n\
unsigned fn10(unsigned p1, short p2) {\n\
  int af = 0x2F2F6D26L;\n\
  unsigned ag = 248UL;\n\
  fn11(2L, ag, p2, 1);\n\
  return af;\n\
}\n\
unsigned char fn11(unsigned char p1, unsigned p2, int p3, short p4) {\n\
  long ai = 7L;\n\
  short aj = 1UL;\n\
  fn12(ai, ai, p1, 0, p1);\n\
  return aj;\n\
}\n\
short fn12(int p1, int p2, unsigned char p3, short p4, unsigned p5) {\n\
  int al = 3L;\n\
  long am = 1L;\n\
  int an;\n\
  for (w = 3; w; w -= 1)\n\
    if (an = 250UL) {\n\
      p2 = ac || (an = w) == 0x294A85636008822DLL;\n\
      short ao = 0xBCD1L;\n\
      if (fn2(fn3(ao, fn4(fn6(am, an), 0xECL)), p2) & 1UL)\n\
        v = 1UL;\n\
    }\n\
  return al;\n\
}\n\
int main() {\n\
  int ap = 0;\n\
  fn10(u, t);\n\
  fn9(v, \"g_170\", ap);\n\
  printf(\"checksum = %X\\n\", p);\n\
  return 0;\n\
}"
}
```
